issue.title: #20: Ability to run directly from the console with ease.

content.raw: Qt can be headless, yes, but I think there may be issues compiling Qt on some headless systems if they, for instance, don't have X11 or something like that. Seems like an odd choice to keep Qt on Python just for the event managing bits, but I guess we'll see how it evolves.
content.html: Qt can be headless, yes, but I think there may be issues compiling Qt on some headless systems if they, for instance, don't have X11 or something like that. Seems like an odd choice to keep Qt on Python just for the event managing bits, but I guess we'll see how it evolves.
